posts.name: Ben Miller
posts.cooked:
Updated to the 2025 library to use the new rev commands.

hangs and doesn’t return anyhing like it usually does. The same goes for test, deploy, and even just running:

hangs and returns nothing.

When I uninstall robotpy using pip it doesn’t tell me that the module is gone unlike the following example:

it just hangs and returns nothing even when uninstalled.

I have to completely uninstall all programs installed by pip to get it to stop hanging and return to expected behavior:

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
So… when you install robotpy again, does it repeat the same behavior?

I haven’t had this problem, but I also don’t use windows.

posts.name: Ben Miller
posts.cooked: Yes. It is a maddening cycle lol

posts.name: Ben Miller
posts.cooked: I’ve tried the beta versions in addition to 2025.1.1.0

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: Weird. When you kill the hanging process via CTRL-C, is there a stack trace?

posts.name: Ben Miller
posts.cooked: There does not appear to be a stack trace. Is there a verbose option I could try to get you some more information?

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: I haven’t tried it myself windows, but someone else did and it appears to work… so this sounds like a weird problem specific to your machine. I would recommend uninstalling python completely and reinstalling it.

posts.name: Ben Miller
posts.cooked: I have uninstalled it completely and reinstalled and the problem persists. I have uninstalled all python 3 options, reinstalled both 3.12 and 3.13 individually with no change in result for either version

posts.name: Ben Miller
posts.cooked: Another mentor was having the same issue on their machine last night while we were trying to work through it. (Also windows)

posts.name: Justin Buist
posts.cooked:
Is this on a school network? Just wondering if there’s a proxy server intercepting that call out to download the .ipk for the RoboRIO from Github. Maybe that’s what makes it hang?

(I did a robotpy install on a fresh win11 vm. It didn’t hang but I gave up trying to resolve an SSL cert error on that ipk download step)

posts.name: Ben Miller
posts.cooked: It is on a school network. Tried switching to my mobile hotspot and it did not help. I’m not even getting a “can’t find a roborio” message when I attempt a deploy connected to regular internet.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
Maybe, but you should see some output. It feels like something else is going on here however… like maybe python isn’t running in console mode, it’s running in windowed mode by default? There might be a flag to py to force that. Maybe instead of running py you could run python or python3 .

If you just run py and do import robotpy does that fail? What if you open up py, and run this?

I’m currently flying to the Carribean for 8 days, but I might be able to debug with an adult over zoom and vscode code share depending on how wifi works in my destination. This is really weird.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: Is it a school laptop? Maybe there’s some security policy stopping you from running python scripts… but that seems weird.

posts.name: Ben Miller
posts.cooked:
still hangs

Appears to be successful?

This is a school computer. I was not having any problems testing/syncing/deploying with the 2024 library before I updated to the 2025 library last night so there shouldn’t be a policy limiting python scripts.

Sorry to interrupt your vacation. I appreciate all of your help. I’d be happy to hop on a zoom call when you arrive. Please feel free to contact me with details (I am mentor).

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
Well, no, that isn’t successful, because you can’t see any output. You should see something like:

Does print('foo') work?

posts.name: Ryan Radtke
posts.cooked: I am also having this issue. It also hangs when there is no robot.py file at all and 2024 still works for me(I’m also on a school computer)

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
If you create a file, add print('foo') to it, does py file.py cause it to print out?

Something is breaking, but honestly the best way to figure out what’s what is to add a bunch of print statements to the robotpy stuff installed in site-packages to see what specific thing is causing it to break.

By executing:

That will give you the path to the main for robotpy… and then just add print statements  from the beginning to see when they stop working.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: How did you install python? From the windows store or from python.org ? I would recommend python.org

posts.name: Ryan Radtke
posts.cooked: I got if from windows. I think there’s something wrong with the _load_robot_class cause after it’s loaded nothing gets printed

posts.name: Ben Miller
posts.cooked:
I gotcha. I installed python 3.13 from python.org .

works just fine.

I will work through putting in a bunch of print statements as you have suggested. Seems like @Ryanforce found a possible issue.

data.fancy_title: Robotpy commands are hanging upon update
data.title: Robotpy commands are hanging upon update

accepted_answer.excerpt: There is a python package that might fix your problems. Can you pip install msvc-runtime and see if that resolves your issues?

links.title: Latest supported Visual C++ Redistributable downloads | Microsoft Learn
